title: Notoglanidium depierrei
text: Notoglanidium depierrei is a species of <a href="catfish">catfish</a> (<a href="order%20%28biology%29">order</a> Siluriformes) <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Claroteidae">Claroteidae</a>. This species is <a href="endemism">endemic</a> to <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a> where it is known only from its <a href="biological%20type">type locality</a> of the <a href="Sanaga%20River">Sanaga River</a> Basin. It reaches a length of about 17.2 <a href="centimetre">centimetre</a>s (6.8 <a href="inch">in</a>) <a href="fish%20measurement">SL</a>. It was formerly considered to be the sole member of the monotypic genus "Platyglanis" but this has now been synonymised with "<a href="Notoglanidium">Notoglanidium</a>".
